name: European Federation of Local Energy Companies
goal:
CEDEC defends, at European level, the interests of local and regional energy companies.
CEDEC represents 1500 companies with a total turnover of about 120 billion Euros, and more than 350.000 employees. Together, they serve 85 million electricity and gas customers & connections.
These predominantly medium-sized local and regional energy companies have developed activities as electricity and heat generators, electricity and gas distribution grid & metering operators and energy (services) suppliers.
interests: Climate Action, Competition, Energy, Environment, Trans-European Networks
euInitiatives:
• New legislation (lobbying activities towards the European Commission, Parliament, Council):
o Internal Market for Electricity: Directive, Regulation, ACER.
o Renewable Energy Directive
o Energy Efficiency and Performance of Buildings Directives
o Gas Directive

• Topics (lobbying activities mainly towards the European Commission and CEER):
o Market Design
o DSO as neutral market facilitator: role and responsibilities
o TSO / DSO cooperation
o Network codes: monitoring
o Retail market and customers: legislation, best practices
o Heating and Cooling
o Renewable Energy Sources: integration and flexibility
o Role of ACER and NRAs
